intro: Navarretia filiformis, commonly known as the slender navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, thread-like leaves and small white flowers. This plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Navarretia filiformis is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to mild, temperate climates. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
